intro: Loxotrema pilosa, commonly known as the hairy lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Lecanoraceae. It is characterized by its dense, woolly growth of hair-like structures, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and a green alga or cyanobacterium, typical of lichens. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on tree trunks or rocks. Its botanical features make it an important indicator species for environmental conditions.
